data.event: The county was created by the legislature of the Mississippi Territory in 1812.

event.title: thousands of years, this area was occupied

data.event: For thousands of years, this area was occupied along the rivers by varying cultures of indigenous peoples.

event.title: 1805, by the Treaty of Mount Dexter, the Choctaw conveyed

data.event: In 1805, by the Treaty of Mount Dexter, the Choctaw conveyed large amounts of land in what is now southeastern Mississippi and southwestern Alabama, including much of the western portion of Clarke County, to the United States for settlement by European Americans.
